meanings.definition: Of or relating to the throat
meanings.sent1: Her guttural singing voice was deep and throaty.
meanings.sent2: The guttural cough indicated a throat infection.
meanings.sent3: The guttural growl of the dog startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The guttural sound of the engine made it seem ancient.
meanings.sent5: The guttural tone of his speech was unmistakable.

meanings.sent1: The guttural laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The guttural language was difficult to understand.
meanings.sent3: The guttural music made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: The guttural feedback from the microphone was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The guttural tone of his voice made her shiver.

meanings.definition: A sound produced in the throat
meanings.sent1: The singer's guttural was unique and captivating.
meanings.sent2: The guttural of the frog could be heard in the night.
meanings.sent3: The guttural of the baby trying to speak was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The guttural of the engine signaled its starting.
meanings.sent5: The guttural of the wind in the trees was soothing.
